doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Display a DNA sequence with 6-frame translation and ORFs

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.label:
Genetic codes?
Standard Standard (with alternative initiation codons) Vertebrate mitochondrial Yeast mitochondrial Mold, protozoan, coelenterate mitochondrial and mycoplasma/spiroplasma Invertebrate mitochondrial Ciliate macronuclear and dasycladacean Echinoderm mitochondrial Euplotid nuclear Bacterial Alternative yeast nuclear Ascidian mitochondrial Flatworm mitochondrial Blepharisma macronuclear Chlorophycean mitochondrial Trematode mitochondrial Scenedesmus obliquus Thraustochytrium mitochondrial
Genetics code used for the translation

Orf at the beginning of the sequence?
Yes No
Count the beginning of a sequence as a possible ORF, even if it's inferior to the minimal ORF size.

Orf at the end of the sequence?
Yes No
Count the end of a sequence as a possible ORF, even if it's not finishing with a STOP, or inferior to the minimal ORF size.

Orf start with an m?
Yes No
Displays only ORFs starting with an M.
Name of the output file (e_outfile)

Name of the output sequence file (e_outseq)?
ORF sequence output
Choose the sequence output format Embl Fasta Gcg Genbank Nbrf Codata Raw Swissprot Gff

Display translation of reverse sense?
Yes No
Display also the translation of the DNA sequence in the 3 reverse frames

Minimum size of orfs (value greater than or equal to 1)?
Minimum size of Open Reading Frames (ORFs) to display in the translations.

Regions to put in uppercase (eg: 4-57,78-94)?
Regions to put in uppercase. If this is left blank, then the sequence case is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are separated by any non-digit, non-alpha character. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45, 56-78 1:45, 67=99;765..888 1,5,8,10,23,45,57,99

Regions to colour in html (eg: 4-57 red 78-94 green)?
Regions to colour if formatting for HTML. If this is left blank, then the sequence is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are followed by any valid HTML font colour. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45 blue 56-78 orange 1-100 green 120-156 red A file of ranges to colour (one range per line) can be specified as '@filename'.

Number the sequences?
Yes No
Number the sequence at the beginning and the end of each line.

Width of sequence to display (value greater than or equal to 1)?
Number of nucleotides displayed on each line
Line length of page (0 for indefinite) (value greater than or equal to 0)
Margin around sequence for numbering. (value greater than or equal to 0)

Display sequence id?
Yes No
Set this to be false if you do not wish to display the ID name of the sequence.

Display description?
Yes No
Set this to be false if you do not wish to display the description of the sequence.

Offset to start numbering the sequence from?
Number from which you want the DNA sequence to be numbered.
Use html formatting Yes No

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Genetics code used for the translation
Count the beginning of a sequence as a possible ORF, even if it's inferior to the minimal ORF size.
Count the end of a sequence as a possible ORF, even if it's not finishing with a STOP, or inferior to the minimal ORF size.
Displays only ORFs starting with an M.
ORF sequence output
Display also the translation of the DNA sequence in the 3 reverse frames
Minimum size of Open Reading Frames (ORFs) to display in the translations.

Regions to put in uppercase. If this is left blank, then the sequence case is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are separated by any non-digit, non-alpha character. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45, 56-78 1:45, 67=99;765..888 1,5,8,10,23,45,57,99

Regions to colour if formatting for HTML. If this is left blank, then the sequence is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are followed by any valid HTML font colour. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45 blue 56-78 orange 1-100 green 120-156 red A file of ranges to colour (one range per line) can be specified as '@filename'.
Number the sequence at the beginning and the end of each line.
Number of nucleotides displayed on each line
Set this to be false if you do not wish to display the ID name of the sequence.
Set this to be false if you do not wish to display the description of the sequence.
Number from which you want the DNA sequence to be numbered.

parameter.name: e_highlight
parameter.prompt: Regions to colour in html (eg: 4-57 red 78-94 green)

comment.text: Regions to colour if formatting for HTML. If this is left blank, then the sequence is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are followed by any valid HTML font colour. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45 blue 56-78 orange 1-100 green 120-156 red A file of ranges to colour (one range per line) can be specified as '@filename'.
